snippet.title: Man dead after Pacific Highway crash
snippet.content:
A MAN has died after a car struck a tree in Port Stephens on Tuesday. Authorities were called to the Pacific Highway near Rangers Road about 11am after the car left the road and hit a tree. Police said the driver, aged in his 20s, died at the scene while a female patient was taken to the John Hunter Hospital.
Her injuries were not considered life-threatening. Port Stephens police have established a crime scene, with crash investigators on site. Motorists are urged to expect delays through the area.
Anyone who witnessed the incident is urged to call Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000.
